Interface MultiUserManager


  • public interface MultiUserManager
    Multiplayer interactive cloud game APIs

    • Method Detail

      • changeSeat

        void changeSeat(java.lang.String userId,
                Role targetRole,
                int targetPlayerIndex,
                AsyncCallback<java.lang.Void> callback)
        Switch the role and seat of a user (`userID`) to `targetRole` and `targetPlayerIndex` respectively.
        If the change succeeds, `AsyncCallback.onSuccess(Object)` will be called back.
        If there is another player on the target seat, the call will fail, and `MULTI_PLAYER_ASSIGN_SEAT_FAILED` will be passed in to `code` of the `AsyncCallback.onFailure(int, String)` callback.
        Only the room owner can call this API. If it is called by a user who is not the room owner, the call will fail, and `MULTI_PLAYER_NO_AUTHORIZED` will be passed in to `code` of the `AsyncCallback.onFailure(int, String)` callback.
        If the API call times out, the call will fail, and `TcrErrorCode.ERR_TIMEOUT` will be passed in to `code` of the `AsyncCallback.onFailure(int, String)` callback.
        Parameters:
        userId - The target user ID
        targetRole - The target role `Role`
        targetPlayerIndex - The target seat. This parameter can take effect only for the `Player` role and will be `0` for the `Viewer` role.
        callback - The callback for the setting result. `AsyncCallback.onSuccess(Object)` will be called back if the setting succeeds. `AsyncCallback.onFailure(int, String)` will be called back if the setting fails.

      • applyChangeSeat

        void applyChangeSeat(java.lang.String userId,
                     Role targetRole,
                     int targetPlayerIndex,
                     AsyncCallback<java.lang.Void> callback)
        Apply to the room owner to switch the role and seat of a player (`userID`) to `targetRole` and `targetPlayerIndex` respectively.
        If the change succeeds, `AsyncCallback.onSuccess(Object)` will be called back.
        This API can only be called by a user who is not the room owner. If it is called by the room owner, the call will fail, and `MULTI_PLAYER_IGNORED_HOST_SUBMIT` will be passed in to `code` of the `AsyncCallback.onFailure(int, String)` callback.
        If the API call times out, the call will fail, and `TcrErrorCode.ERR_TIMEOUT` will be passed in to `code` of the `AsyncCallback.onFailure(int, String)` callback.
        Parameters:
        userId - The target player ID
        targetRole - The target role `Role`
        targetPlayerIndex - The target seat. This parameter can take effect only for the `Player` role and will be `0` for the `Viewer` role.
        callback - The callback for the setting result

      • setMicMute

        void setMicMute(java.lang.String userID,
                int micStatus,
                AsyncCallback<java.lang.Void> callback)
        Change the mic status of the `userID` user.
        The room owner can change the mic status of all users, but other users can change only their own mic status. If the room owner disables the mic of a user, the user cannot enable it.
        If the change succeeds, `AsyncCallback.onSuccess(Object)` will be called back.
        If a non-room owner user passes in `userID` of another user, `AsyncCallback.onFailure(int, String)` will be called back, and MULTI_PLAYER_NO_AUTHORIZED will be passed in to `code`.
        If `userID` is incorrect, `AsyncCallback.onFailure(int, String)` will be called back, and `MULTI_PLAYER_NO_SUCH_USER` will be passed in to `code`.
        Parameters:
        micStatus - The mic status. Valid values: `User.MIC_STATUS_DISABLE`, `User.MIC_STATUS_OFF`, `User.MIC_STATUS_ON`.

      • setVolume

        boolean setVolume(java.lang.String userID,
                  float value)
        Set the gain of the volume level of another user. Set the audio PCM gain value of another user, which is `1.0` by default.
        Parameters:
        userID - The target user ID
        value - A floating point number in the range of [0,10]. If it is greater than 1, it may cause sound distortion.
        Returns:
        The volume level setting result. Valid values: `true`: Set successfully; `false`: Failed to set.

      • syncRoomInfo

        void syncRoomInfo()
        Refresh the information of all seats. The result will be notified through the SeatsListener.onSeatChanged(java.lang.String, java.util.List<com.tencent.tcr.sdk.api.multiplayer.User>, java.util.List<com.tencent.tcr.sdk.api.multiplayer.User>, int, int) callback.

      • setMultiUserListener

        void setMultiUserListener(SeatsListener listener)
        Set the multiplayer interactive cloud game seat listener.
        Note: After this API is called, the object will import the `listener` through a strong reference. You need to call this API again to specify the listener as `null` when exiting the game.
        Parameters:
        listener - SeatsListener
